1.text: A wise son is the doctrine of his father. But he who ridicules does not listen when he is reproved.

2.text: From the fruit of his own month, a man shall be satisfied with good things. But the soul of betrayers is iniquity.

3.text: Whoever guards his mouth guards his soul. But whoever gives no consideration to his speech shall experience misfortunes.

4.text: The lazy one is willing and then not willing. But the soul of he who labors shall be made fat.

5.text: The just shall detest a lying word. But the impious confound and will be confounded.

6.text: Justice guards the way of the innocent. But impiety undermines the sinner.

7.text: One is like the rich, though he has nothing. And another is like the poor, though he has many riches.

8.text: The redemption of a manâ€™s life is his riches. But he who is poor cannot tolerate correction.

9.text: The light of the just enriches. But the lamp of the impious will be extinguished.

10.text: Among the arrogant, there are always conflicts. But those who do everything with counsel are ruled by wisdom.

11.text: Substance obtained in haste will be diminished. But what is collected by hand, little by little, shall be multiplied.

12.text: Hope, when it is delayed, afflicts the soul. The arrival of the desired is a tree of life.

13.text: Whoever denounces something obligates himself for the future. But whoever fears a lesson shall turn away in peace. Deceitful souls wander into sins. The just are merciful and compassionate.

14.text: The law of the wise is a fountain of life, so that he may turn aside from the ruin of death.

15.text: Good doctrine bestows grace. In the way of the contemptuous, there is a chasm.

16.text: The discerning do everything with counsel. But whoever is senseless discloses his stupidity.

17.text: The messenger of the impious will fall into evil. But a faithful ambassador shall prosper.

18.text: Destitution and disgrace are for those who abandon discipline. But whoever agrees with a reproof shall be glorified.

19.text: The desired, when perfected, shall delight the soul. The foolish detest those who flee from evils.

20.text: Whoever keeps step with the wise shall be wise. A friend of the foolish will become like them.

21.text: Evil pursues sinners. And good things shall be distributed to the just.

22.text: The good leave behind heirs: children and grandchildren. And the substance of the sinner is preserved for the just.

23.text: Much nourishment is in the fallow land of the fathers. But for others, it is gathered without judgment.

24.text: He who spares the rod hates his son. But he who loves him urgently instructs him.

25.text: The just eats and fills his soul. But the belly of the impious is never satisfied.
